Record date: 2075-01-15
AASC EMERGENCY DEPT VISIT
QUIJANO,BAYLEE 853-62-51-4 VISIT DATE: 01/15/75 The patient was worked up in the emergency department by myself and the resident, and I concur with her work up and evaluation in the emergency department. PRESENTING COMPLAINT: Chest pain, shortness of breath, productive cough. HISTORY OF PRESENTING COMPLAINT: This patient is a 60-year-old female that presents to the emergency department at Associated Arthritis with complaints of chest pain, shortness of breath and a cough productive of white sputum. The patient denies fever or chills. She denies any other acute complaints. PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Morbid obesity, congestive heart failure, hypertension, rheumatoid arthritis. MEDICATIONS: Zestril, a water pill most likely Lasix, Motrin and Tylenol. ALLERGIES: No known allergies. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: VITAL SIGNS: Temperature 99, pulse 85, respiratory rate 16, blood pressure 214/117. Oxygen saturation 92% on two liters. HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic. Pupils equal, round, reactive. Positive AV nicking. NECK: Positive for jugular venous distension. CHEST: Rales audible bilaterally. HEART: Normal S1/S2. No S3/S4. No murmur. ABDOMEN: Soft, nontender. EXTREMITIES: Positive for 2-3+ pitting edema. NEURO: She was awake, alert, and able to follow commands. LABORATORY EVALUATION: CK 84. White count 10, hemoglobin 12, hematocrit 42, platelet count 329. Urinalysis noted 1+ blood in her urine, however, overall, her urinalysis was negative. Chest x-ray which noted cardiomegaly with findings consistent with congestive heart failure. EKG noted no acute changes. THERAPY RENDERED/COURSE IN ED: The patient was given 40 mg of Lasix IV initially. For her chest pain, she was given sublingual nitroglycerin. She was also given one aspirin. She had a nitroglycerin patch placed in the emergency department. FINAL DIAGNOSIS: 1. Congestive failure. 2. Chest pain, no evidence of an acute myocardial infarction. DISPOSITION (including condition upon discharge): The patient will be admitted to the medicine service for further work up and evaluation. The patient is in stable condition. ___________________________________ CY313/62627 O. DE OTIS, M.D. DO36 D:01/18/75 T:01/18/75 Dictated by: O. DE OTIS, M.D. DO36 ******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
